meanings.definition: A person who speaks or cries out loudly.
meanings.sent1: The vociferators in the crowd cheered for their team.
meanings.sent2: The group of vociferators outside the concert venue were protesting loudly.
meanings.sent3: The vociferators at the town hall meeting made sure their voices were heard.
meanings.sent4: The vociferators in the forest, the chirping birds, created a symphony of sound.
meanings.sent5: The vociferators in the classroom were reprimanded for disrupting the lesson.

meanings.definition: A group of people who make loud and insistent noises.
meanings.sent1: The vociferators at the protest demanded change.
meanings.sent2: The vociferators in the stadium cheered for their team.
meanings.sent3: The vociferators in the movie theater were shushed by annoyed patrons.
meanings.sent4: The vociferators in the market created a bustling atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The vociferators in the street parade added to the festive mood.

meanings.definition: To speak or cry out loudly and vehemently.
meanings.sent1: She vociferators her opinions during the heated debate.
meanings.sent2: The politician vociferators against the proposed legislation.
meanings.sent3: The toddler vociferators for more cookies before bedtime.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm vociferators its fury across the dark sky.
meanings.sent5: The coach vociferators instructions to the players on the field.
